title: job-11.jpg
comments.comment:
I've seen this popping up across the Internet over the past week.  If there's any truth in it, it sounds like what I'd call lazy-IT.

I've yet to learn of an identity management system that can't handle username changes.  And at worst, it'd be a manual process to modify all the downstream applications that may not automatically update a username.

A workaround could also be applied, which is to create an email alias for the person.  This shouldn't be too much work?  This goes to my point of calling this "lazy-IT".; A full name email address should do the trick, except my friend Srini. His email address is 40 characters long - Srinivas.Bangalore-Vaidyanathan-Venkatarangaiah@paradise.com.au :-); Full name by default, plus useful aliases shouldn't be a problem
